Title: Datumsformate bei MySQL
Content:
Funktion DATE_FORMAT(datum, "%Y-%m-%d")
Beispiele:

DROP VIEW IF EXISTS topfact.pds_d_rechnungsbuch;
CREATE OR REPLACE ALGORITHM=UNDEFINED DEFINER=admin@localhost SQL SECURITY DEFINER VIEW pds_d_rechnungsbuch AS 
select 
r.nummer AS belegnr,
DATE_FORMAT(r.beleg_datum, "%Y-%m-%d") AS datum,
r.bezeichnung AS text,
r.bruttosumme AS Bruttobetrag,
r.ktrkst AS ktrg,
l.nachname AS ansname,
l.nummer AS kundennr from (pds_rechnung r left join pds_view_lieferantendaten l on((r.person_dbid = l.geschaeftspartner_id)));


DROP VIEW IF EXISTS topfact.pds_bekopf_lfzus_ansname;
CREATE OR REPLACE ALGORITHM=UNDEFINED DEFINER=admin@localhost SQL SECURITY DEFINER VIEW pds_bekopf_lfzus_ansname AS 
select 
pds_br_view_bestellungsdaten.vorgang_nummer AS BestellNr,
pds_br_view_bestellungsdaten.projekt_nr AS KommNr,
DATE_FORMAT(pds_br_view_bestellungsdaten.beleg_datum, "%Y-%m-%d") AS Bestelldatum,
pds_br_view_bestellungsdaten.lieferant_nummer AS AnschriftNr,
pds_br_view_bestellungsdaten.lieferant_name AS Name1
from pds_br_view_bestellungsdaten 

union 

select 
w.nummer AS BestellNr,
w.ktrkst AS KommNr,
DATE_FORMAT(w.beleg_datum, "%Y-%m-%d") AS Bestelldatum,
l.nummer AS AnschriftNr,
l.nachname AS Name1
from (pds_wareneingang w left join pds_view_lieferantendaten l on((w.person_dbid = l.geschaeftspartner_id)));
